document_data.name: Huntcrown
document_data.mainbody: '''Huntcrown''' was a noble house of [[Cormyr]].{{Cite dungeon/198/Backdrop: Suzail|69}}
document_data.Base of Operations: Their seat was the Huntcrown Estate in [[Suzail]].{{Cite dungeon/198/Backdrop: Suzail|66}}
document_data.History: During the [[abraxus affair]] in the {{YearlinkName|1369}}, the family was apparently among those that favored a ruling council for Cormyr rather than any regency or continued [[Obarskyr]] rule.
document_data.Activities: ''Circa'' [[1479 DR]], the family had diverse holdings all over Cormyr and thus often was the best informed of the nation's goings-on. The family was known for spreading gossip and rumors and was at the center of the greatest number of scandals of any noble family.{{Cite dungeon/198/Backdrop: Suzail}}
document_data.Relations: The family's greatest adversary was once the [[Cormaeril]] family, whose members jealously guarded their privacy. However, after the Cormaerils were exiled after the abraxus affair, the Huntcrowns developed a rivalry with [[Emmarask|Houses Emmarask]], [[Illance]] and [[Marliir]].

Members.14{{th}} Century:
* [[Krell Huntcrown]], head of the family, and husband of Lady Ohrmatha
* [[Ohrmatha Huntcrown]], wife of Lord Krell
* [[Ulnder Huntcrown]], one of the knights who rode with Princess [[Alusair]]
* [[Tabart Huntcrown]]<ref>
* [[Belmer Huntcrown]]<ref>{{Cite dragon annual/2000/After the Dragon: The Kingdom of Cormyr Today|66}}
Members.Late 15{{th}} Century:
* [[Gerain Huntcrown]], [[Purple Dragons#Structure and Hierarchy|Oversword]] and member of the War Council.
* [[Lindon Huntcrown]], short-lived husband of Queen [[Raedra Obarskyr]], exposed as an agent of [[Netheril]].
* [[Turin Huntcrown]], the once granduncle-in-law of Raedra Obarskyr.
